titleStmt.title: The faerie leveller: or, King Charles his leveller descried and deciphered in Queene Elizabeths dayes. By her poet laureat Edmond Spenser, in his unparaleld poeme, entituled, The faerie queene. A lively representation of our times.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed just levell anens the Saints Army,
publicationStmt.date: bin the yeare of their saintships ungodly revelling for a godly levelling. 1648.

notesStmt.note: An extract from "The faerie queene", book 5, canto 2, stanzas 29-54.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
